meanings.definition: Lack of faith or belief in something.
meanings.sent1: Her misfaith in the weather forecast led her to bring an umbrella even on a sunny day.
meanings.sent2: His misfaith in the existence of aliens made him skeptical of UFO sightings.
meanings.sent3: The misfaith in his ability to win the game was evident in his nervous laughter.
meanings.sent4: The misfaith in the old bridge's stability made him hesitant to cross it.
meanings.sent5: The misfaith in the magic potion's effectiveness was shattered when it failed to cure his cold.

meanings.definition: Doubt or skepticism towards a belief or idea.
meanings.sent1: Their misfaith in the new policy made them question its effectiveness.
meanings.sent2: The scientist's misfaith in the theory led him to conduct more experiments.
meanings.sent3: The misfaith in the talking parrot's intelligence made everyone laugh.
meanings.sent4: Her misfaith in love was like a dark cloud overshadowing her relationships.
meanings.sent5: The misfaith in the fortune teller's predictions proved to be unfounded.
